Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though.
That being said, as a piece of film history hate or love it it's importance and influence on future films can't be denied. Few movies have been copied so many times.
When you read "once upon a time" you know what's gonna happen even before tuning in.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since fled Planet Earth, for with enough money one could emigrate to Orbitals above where there seems to be plenty of dishnow meat---an animal grown as food without natural slaughterers. Did the unthinkable happen? Could this affected an entire population on our planet? Scientists

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to be criticized by some because it has very little coherence or actual martial arts, and ultimately that's true but there's one thing you have to remember with this movie; is isn't meant to take itself seriously. It doesn't present anything worthwhile for intelligent thought of any kind
